div.head: Proposition 15
div.p:
Fernando and Isabel, monarchs of Castilla and León, have singular prerogatives—more than other Christian kings—in that they were vested with the office of preaching the Gospel to the New World, by the Vicar of Christ. It was by nothing less than divine authority that they were instituted and invested with the highest dignity that kings have ever had over the earth. That is, they are the architectonic apostles of the Indies.
Among other excellencies, they had these two. The first, which they inherited from their ancestors’ dedication to the Reconquista, was their reconquest of all these kings of Spain from the tyrannical Mahometan enemies of the faith. They achieved this with much spilling of their own royal blood and with their own royal persons. By incomparable works, they finally restored the great kingdom of Granada to Christ and to the universal Church.
The second was that, at their own expense and by their favor and command, they sent Columbus, who they honored with the title of First Admiral, and so the most extensive Indies were discovered.
